meta.title: ACTUS
meta.description: Algorithmic Contract Types Unified Standards. A taxonomy and standard for financial contracts.
meta.keywords: ACTUS, Algorithmic, Contract, Types, Unified, Standards

body: Algorithmic Contract Types Unified Standards. A taxonomy and standard for financial contracts.

meta.title: ASIC
meta.description: An ‚ÄúApplication Specific Integrated Circuit‚Äù is a silicon chip specifically designed to do a single task.

body: An ‚ÄúApplication Specific Integrated Circuit‚Äù is a silicon chip specifically designed to do a single task. In the case of Bitcoin, they are designed to process SHA-256 hashing problems to mine new bitcoins. ASICs are considered to be much more efficient than conventional hardware(CPUs, GPUs). Using a regular computer for Bitcoin mining is seen as unprofitable and only results in higher electricity bill

meta.title: Active endpoint
meta.description: An endpoint that is active on a contract application instance.

body: An endpoint that is active on a contract application instance. Indicates that the contract application instance is waiting for input. The set of active endpoints is part of the state of the contract application instance and changes over time.

meta.title: Ada (‚Ç≥)
meta.description: The digital currency (or cryptocurrency) of the Cardano blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 million Lovelaces. Ada and Lovelace are named after the mathematician [Ada Lovelace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).
meta.keywords: Hard Fork, Hard Fork Combinator, HFC

body: The digital currency (or cryptocurrency) of the Cardano blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 million Lovelaces. Ada and Lovelace are named after the mathematician [Ada Lovelace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

meta.title: Adalite
meta.description: A simple Cardano web wallet developed by Cardano partners Vacuumlabs.
meta.aliases: adalite, hardware wallet, cardano wallet, staking cardano, cardano staking, cardano hardware wallet, vaccumlabs
meta.keywords: ada, lite, hardware, wallet, staking, security, cardano, vaccumlabs

body: A simple Cardano web wallet developed by Cardano partners Vacuumlabs. You can also stake ADA from your Ledger or Trezor hardware wallet using [Adalite](https://adalite.io/).

meta.title: address
meta.description: The address of an UTXO says where the output is ‚Äúgoing‚Äù.

body: The address of an UTXO says where the output is ‚Äúgoing‚Äù. The address stipulates the conditions for unlocking the output. This can be a public key hash, or (in the Extended UTXO model) a script hash.

meta.title: Adrestia
meta.description: Adrestia is a collection of products which makes it easier to integrate with [Cardano](/en/cardano).
meta.aliases: adrestia, cardano, api, apis, cli, sdk
meta.keywords: adrestia, cardano, api, apis, cli, sdk

body: Adrestia is a collection of products which makes it easier to integrate with [Cardano](/en/cardano.md). It is made of several application programming interfaces (APIs), command-line interfaces (CLIs), and software development kits (SDKs). Alternatively, Adrestia may also refer to the team working on the project itself.

meta.title: altcoins
meta.description: An ‚ÄúApplication Specific Integrated Circuit‚Äù is a silicon chip specifically designed to do a single task.

body: Altcoin is an abbreviation of ‚ÄúBitcoin alternative‚Äù. Currently, the majority of altcoins are forks of Bitcoin with usually minor changes to the proof of work (POW) algorithm of the Bitcoin blockchain.

meta.title: Block
meta.description: A slot that contains a set of recent transactions on a blockchain network. Each block contains data required to manage the blockchain, including an encrypted version of the previous block.
meta.keywords: Hard Fork, Hard Fork Combinator, HFC

body: A slot that contains a set of recent transactions on a blockchain network. Each block contains data required to manage the blockchain, including an encrypted version of the previous block.

meta.title: Blockchain explorer
meta.description: An online tool for exploring the blockchain of a particular cryptocurrency

body: An online tool for exploring the blockchain of a particular cryptocurrency, where you can watch and follow live all the transactions happening on the blockchain. Block explorers can serve as blockchain analysis and provide information such as total network hash rate, coin supply, transaction growth, etc.

meta.title: Blockchain
meta.description: A growing list of records, called blocks, that are linked using cryptography. Each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data. Blockchain is a fundamental system underpinning cryptocurrencies, acting as the public transaction ledger.
meta.keywords: Hard Fork, Hard Fork Combinator, HFC

body: A growing list of records, called blocks, that are linked using cryptography. Each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data. Blockchain is a fundamental system underpinning cryptocurrencies, acting as the public transaction ledger.

meta.title: Cardano
meta.description: The blockchain system upon which the Plutus Platform is built.
meta.aliases: Cardano, Cardano blockchain, Cardano Cryptocurreny, ADA

body:
Cardano is a proof-of-stake blockchain platform: the first to be founded on peer-reviewed research and developed through evidence-based methods. It combines pioneering technologies to provide unparalleled security and sustainability to decentralized applications, systems, and societies.

With a leading team of engineers, Cardano exists to redistribute power from unaccountable structures to the margins ‚Äì to individuals ‚Äì and be an enabling force for positive change and progress.

meta.description: A set of blocks that have been produced and are connected to one another in consecutive order.
meta.keywords: Hard Fork, Hard Fork Combinator, HFC

body: A set of blocks that have been produced and are connected to one another in consecutive order.

body: A class of token whose forging is controlled by a particular monetary policy script. On the Cardano ledger there is a special currency called Ada which can never be forged and which is controlled separately.

meta.title: Daedalus
meta.description: A secure wallet for Ada that manages balances and provides the ability to send and receive payments. Daedalus is a full node wallet which means that it downloads a full copy of the Cardano blockchain and independently validates every transaction in its history. It has a friendly user interface and is recommended for new users to start with. [More information](https://daedaluswallet.io/).
meta.keywords: Hard Fork, Hard Fork Combinator, HFC

body: A secure wallet for Ada that manages balances and provides the ability to send and receive payments. Daedalus is a full node wallet which means that it downloads a full copy of the Cardano blockchain and independently validates every transaction in its history. It has a friendly user interface and is recommended for new users to start with. [More information](https://daedaluswallet.io/).

body: Decentralization refers to the property of a system in which nodes or actors work in concert in a distributed fashion to achieve a global goal. The delegation of power from a central authority to regional and local authorities

body: The process by which Ada owners can participate in the network and earn rewards by delegating the stake associated with their Ada holdings to a stake pool.

meta.description: When a digital currency is spent more than once. Historically this was a problem with early versions of cryptocurrencies.  Bitcoin was the first cryptocurrency to solve this problem.

body: When a digital currency is spent more than once. Historically this was a problem with early versions of cryptocurrencies.  Bitcoin was the first cryptocurrency to solve this problem.

meta.title: Fifty-one percent attack
meta.description: If more than half the computer power on a network is run by a single person or a single group of people, then a 51% attack is in operation.
meta.keywords: 51, %, attack, fifty, one, percent, cardano, bitcoin

body: If more than half the computer power on a network is run by a single person or a single group of people, then a 51% attack is in operation. This means this entity has full control of the network and can negatively affect a cryptocurrency by halting mining, disabling staking, stopping or changing transactions, and reusing coins.

meta.aliases: forging, forge, forged, minting, minted, minting, minter, txs

body: A transaction which forges tokens creates new tokens, providing that the corresponding monetary policy script is satisfied. The amount forged can be negative, in which case the tokens will be destroyed instead of created.

meta.title: Incentive
meta.description: A way to encourage participants of the system to engage in the network by rewarding them with a return that is proportional to their efforts.

body: A way to encourage participants of the system to engage in the network by rewarding them with a return that is proportional to their efforts. Incentives aim to ensure equality and fairness in a distributed network of participants by encouraging consistent, active, and strong participation. Cardano‚Äôs incentives model uses game theory to calculate the incentives required.

meta.title: IOG

meta.title: IPFS
meta.description: The InterPlanetary File System (IPFS) is a hypermedia distribution protocol, addressed by content and identities.

body: The InterPlanetary File System (IPFS) is a hypermedia distribution protocol, addressed by content and identities. IPFS enables the creation of completely distributed applications. It aims to make the web faster, safer, and more open. IPFS is an open source project developed by the team at Interplanetary Networks and many contributors from the open source community. It is a peer-to-peer distributed file system that seeks to connect all computing devices with the same system of files. In some ways, IPFS is similar to the Web, but IPFS could be seen as a single BitTorrent swarm, exchanging objects within one Git repository. In other words, IPFS provides a high throughput content-addressed block storage model, with content-addressed hyperlinks. This forms a generalized Merkle DAG, a data structure upon which one can build versioned file systems, blockchains, and even a Permanent Web. IPFS combines a distributed hash table, an incentivized block exchange, and a self-certifying namespace. IPFS has no single point of failure, and nodes do not need to trust each other.

meta.title: Live stake
meta.description: the total amount of stake that a stake pool controls. It combines the stake that is owned by the pool operator with any stake that has been delegated to the pool by other ada holders. It can be measured as a total ada amount (e.g. 3M ada), or as a percentage of the total supply of ada within the network (e.g. 5%).
meta.keywords: live stake, what is live stake, live stake meaning

body: the total amount of stake that a stake pool controls. It combines the stake that is owned by the pool operator with any stake that has been delegated to the pool by other ada holders. It can be measured as a total ada amount (e.g. 3M ada), or as a percentage of the total supply of ada within the network (e.g. 5%).

This can be any kind of information (currency or commodity exchange rates, events happening in the real world, etc.). Cardano has steadily been working on partnerships to connect to a variety of data sources to serve as Oracles for the Cardano network. [Intro to Oracles](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BLR8eX73SA4).

meta.description: A program which interacts with a contract application instance via the PAB‚Äôs client API.

body:
A program which interacts with a contract application instance via the PAB‚Äôs client API. Examples of PAB clients include:

1. Wallet frontends such as Daedalus.

2. Other user software which uses the contract application as part of a wider system.

meta.title: Pledge
meta.description: Pledging is an important mechanism that encourages the growth of a healthy ecosystem within the Cardano blockchain.m
meta.aliases: pledge, pledging, pledge ada, stake pool pledge

body: Pledging is an important mechanism that encourages the growth of a healthy ecosystem within the Cardano blockchain. When you register a stake pool you can choose to pledge some, or all, of your ada to the pool, to make it more attractive to people that want to delegate. Although pledging is not required when setting up a stake pool, it can make the stake pool more attractive to delegators, as the higher the amount of ada that is pledged, the higher the rewards that will be paid out. The a0 protocol parameter defines the influence of the pledge on the pool reward.

meta.title: Plutus Application Backend (PAB)
meta.description: The component which manages Plutus Applications that run on users' machines.

body:
The component which manages Plutus Applications that run on users‚Äô machines. It handles:

1. Interactions with the node

2. Interactions with the wallet backend

3. Interactions with the wallet frontend

4. State management

5. Tracking historical chain information

meta.title: Plutus application
meta.description: An application written using the Plutus Application Framework.

body: An application written using the Plutus Application Framework.

meta.title: Plutus core
meta.description: The programming language in which scripts on the Cardano blockchain are written.

body: The programming language in which scripts on the Cardano blockchain are written. Plutus Core is a small functional programming language‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâa formal specification is available with further details. Plutus Core is not read or written by humans, it is a compilation target for other languages. [What is plutus core?](https://docs.cardano.org/projects/plutus/en/latest/plutus/explanations/plutus-foundation.html#what-is-plutus-foundation)

meta.title: Plutus IR
meta.description: An intermediate language that compiles to Plutus Core.

body: An intermediate language that compiles to Plutus Core. Plutus IR is not used by users, but rather as a compilation target on the way to Plutus Core. However, it is significantly more human-readable than Plutus Core, so should be preferred in cases where humans may want to inspect the program.

This stake is used as the main resource to determine the participant‚Äôs power in the system for maintaining the ledger.

This stake is used as the main resource to determine the participant‚Äôs power in the system for maintaining the ledger.

With PoW, ‚Äúminers‚Äù (those performing the computational work) compete against each other to complete transactions on the network and get rewarded.

meta.title: Sybil Attack
meta.description: Sybil Attack is a type of attack seen in peer-to-peer networks in which a node in the network operates multiple identities actively at the same time and undermines the authority/power in reputation systems.

body: Sybil Attack is a type of attack seen in peer-to-peer networks in which a node in the network operates multiple identities actively at the same time and undermines the authority/power in reputation systems. The main aim of this attack is to gain the majority of influence in the network to carry out illegal(with respect to rules and laws set in the network) actions in the system. A single entity(a computer) has the capability to create and operate multiple identities(user accounts, IP address based accounts). To outside observers, these multiple fake identities appear to be real unique identities.

meta.title: Token
meta.description: A cryptographic token that represents a footprint of value defined by the community, market state, or self-governed entity. A token can be fungible or non-fungible, and act as a payment unit, reward, trading asset, or information holder.
meta.aliases: token, cardano token, cardano asset, cardano native asset

body: A cryptographic token that represents a footprint of value defined by the community, market state, or self-governed entity. A token can be fungible or non-fungible, and act as a payment unit, reward, trading asset, or information holder.

meta.title: Utility token

body: A digital token that holds certain functionality in regards to a concrete project or environment. These tokens can be used as payment units, rewards, or grant access to a specific network.

meta.title: UTXO
meta.description: UTXO stands for ‚ÄúUnspent Transaction Output‚Äù. In cryptocurrencies, a UTXO is an abstraction of electronic money. Each UTXO is analogous to a coin, and holds a certain amount of value in its respective currency.
meta.aliases: utxo, utxo model, cardano utxo model

body: UTXO stands for ‚ÄúUnspent Transaction Output‚Äù. In cryptocurrencies, a UTXO is an abstraction of electronic money. Each UTXO is analogous to a coin, and holds a certain amount of value in its respective currency. Another way to look at it, using a fiat money analogy, is that UTXOs represent various amounts of ‚Äúchange‚Äù available to any particular user. The unspent values in each block are UTXOs, and when they are ‚Äúspent‚Äù (used in a transaction) they create new ‚Äúchange‚Äù (new UTXOs). [Detailed information](https://medium.com/bitbees/what-the-heck-is-utxo-ca68f2651819). [Simple video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hKft6E4K8KY).

meta.title: Validator context
meta.description: A data structure containing a summary of the transaction being validated, and the current input whose validator is being run.

body: A data structure containing a summary of the transaction being validated, and the current input whose validator is being run.

meta.title: Validator script
meta.description: The script attached to a script output in the Extended UTXO model.

body: The script attached to a script output in the Extended UTXO model. Must be run and return positively in order for the output to be spent. Determines the address of the output.

meta.title: Voltaire
meta.description: The fifth phase of Cardano development in which treasury and governance capabilities will be delivered.

body: The fifth phase of Cardano development in which treasury and governance capabilities will be delivered.

meta.title: Whale üêã
meta.description: A whale is defined as a person or organization that owns a large amount of a particular cryptocurrency.
meta.aliases: whale, crypto whale, wale, wael, michael saylor

body: A whale is defined as a person or organization that owns a large amount of a particular cryptocurrency. The quantity of cryptocurrency owned by whales is usually enough to affect the market, giving them the ability to manipulate prices. Crypto whales are named after the sea mammal due to their huge size in comparison to other sea creatures, such as fish.

meta.title: Yoroi
meta.description: A light wallet for Cardano that is used to manage Ada balances and conduct transactions. A simple, fast, and secure wallet for daily use purposes that is developed by Emurgo. [More information](https://yoroi-wallet.com/#/).

body: A light wallet for Cardano that is used to manage Ada balances and conduct transactions. A simple, fast, and secure wallet for daily use purposes that is developed by Emurgo. [More information](https://yoroi-wallet.com/#/).
